projects.title: (Horizon Europe) AI4HF: Trustworthy Artificial Intelligence for Personalised Risk Assessment in Chronic Heart Failure
(HorizonEurope) SIRENE: Social Innovation Responsive Environments NETwork
projects.description: The main aim of SIRENE is to support the growth of social innovation ecosystems delivering eco-friendly and sustainable community-based services for SHAFE (Smart Healthy Age-Friendly Environments) implementation in Europe, by providing a workable framework for investment and the broad adoption of high-quality smart living solutions, combining the housing sector and ICT infrastructure.

projects.title: (Horizon Europe) RadioVal:  International Clinical Validation of Radiomics Artificial Intelligence for Breast Cancer Treatment Planning
projects.description: RadioVal is the first major multicentre, multicontinental and multifaceted project to clinically validate the estimation of radiomic-guided adjuvant chemotherapy in the response to breast cancer, in eight clinical centers in Europe, Argentina, Egypt and Turkey. The RadioVal consortium brings together 16 partners from 13 countries. SHINE is coordinating WP1: Multi-stakeholder engagement and social innovation.

projects.title: (H2020) RE-SAMPLE: Proactive and tailor-made care for complex chronic conditions
projects.description: Timely and preventive care is essential for multi-morbid complex chronic conditions (CCCs) which are highly prevalent in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, a chronic lung disease. The EU-funded RE-SAMPLE project will develop evidence-based, inclusive, preventive care and targeted treatment, making it possible to ‘treat a person, not the disease(s)’. A knowledge base of multimodal data (health records, clinical studies and real-world data) together with predictive modelling through privacy-preserving AI, will increase the understanding of CCCs. This knowledge is incorporated in a virtual companionship programme that facilitates shared decision-making and is implemented in three hospitals around Europe. Overall, RE-SAMPLE works towards a diversified, personalised care method that reduces the societal and economic burden of CCCs.

projects.title: (H2020) TERMINET: nexT gEneRation sMart INterconnectEd ioT
projects.description: Tens of billions of devices are connected to the Internet of Things (IoT), and the number of connections is growing every second. Information is being constantly sent and received from one smart device to another. Based on cutting-edge technologies such as software-defined networking (SDN), multiple-access edge computing, and virtualisation for next-generation IoT, the EU-funded TERMINET project will develop a novel next-generation reference architecture. Its main aim is to simplify the connection of a vast number of different devices through a flexible SDN-enabled middleware layer. To improve supply chain processes, the project will design an IoT-driven decentralised and distributed blockchain framework within manufacturing. TERMINET’s approach will be tested in real-life situations such as energy, smart buildings, smart farming, healthcare and manufacturing.

projects.title: (AAL Programme) LEAVES: optimizing the mentaL health and resiliencE of older Adults that haVe lost thEir spouSe via blended, online therapy
projects.description:
Loss of a spouse is a frequent occurrence in later life. While most older adults successfully process this loss and will return to a normal life, a significant proportion is unable to do this. They end up with prolonged grief (PG), a condition where grief symptoms occur longer than 6 months after the loss, and which can result in many mental and physical problems, like poor sleep, cardiovascular problems, depression, loneliness and suicidal tendencies.

In order to prevent PG or to treat it, so that older mourners can lead an active, meaningful and dignified life, we will develop an online grief program: Leaves. Leaves will cater to secondary end-users (family, informal caregivers) by reducing stress. Older adults, informal caregivers and relevant care professionals will, together with the project team, develop the Leaves service model, and, through iterative design and development, will optimize its usability and user experience.

projects.title: (H2020) Back-UP: Personalised Prognostic Models to Improve Well-being and Return to Work After Neck and Low Back Pain
projects.description: The Back-UP Project works for a better, personalised, faster and evidence-based management of neck and low back pain, through the development of a technological platform with prognostic models, addressed to patients, clinicians and occupational managers, based on the digital representation of multidimensional clinical information, and in-silico assessments of possible interventions.

projects.title: (H2020) HoloBalance: Holograms for personalised virtual coaching and motivation in ageing population with balance disorders
projects.description: In HOLOBALANCE we are developing and validating a new personalized hologram coaching platform for virtual coaching, motivation and empowerment of the ageing population with balance disorders.

projects.title: (H2020) SmartWork: Smart Age-friendly Living and Working Environment
projects.description: The SmartWork project builds a worker-centric AI system to support active and healthy ageing at work for older office workers. The aim is to keep ageing people working for longer by supporting them with unobtrusive sensing and monitoring of their health, behaviour, cognitive and emotional status, and responding to their needs.

projects.title: (Interreg) ViReP: Virtual Reality for Pain Therapy
projects.description:
In the ViReP project technicians work together with clinicians in the development of an immersive virtual reality environment to support training for patients with chronic back pain.
Main responsibility within the project: requirements elicitation, ethical approval procedures, supervision of the trial, internal coordination of the project between Nov 2017 and Mar 2018

Virtual Reality Entrepreneur, CEO and Founder at Halocline GmbH & Co. KG

projects.title: AIRplay: Mobile gaming environment to support self-management of asthma among children aged 7 to 12
projects.description: AIRplay incorporates sensing and smart coaching strategies in a mobile gaming environment, to improve physical (re-) conditioning, and teach children aged 7 to 9 strategies to self-manage their asthma in a fun manner. AIRplay is developed combining medical and technical expertise, and its feasibility will be evaluated as a starting point towards future clinical trials.

contributors.headline: Project manager Medical Systems | Industrial design engineer

projects.title: PERSSILAA
projects.description: PERSSILAA is a European project that develops and validates a new service model, to screen for and prevent frailty in community dwelling older adults, integrating nutrition, physical and cognitive function. Main responsibility within the project is to coordinate the design and development of an unobtrusive monitoring tool to get detailed insight into the daily functioning of the older adults.

projects.title: eWall
projects.description: eWall is a European project that aims to create a system that will extend the state-of-the-art of Assistive Platforms and significantly increase the independent living of seniors. eWALL will be an affordable, easy-to-install prefabricated wall that can be mounted on an existing wall and includes, into the background, all the ICT technology needed to enable a number of services for the senior citizen to cover the major ontologies of Active and Healthy Ageing.

projects.title: SWELL: Smart reasoning systems for Well-being at work and at home
projects.description: SWELL project is part of the COMMIT/ program (www.commit-nl.nl). My master thesis research is included in Work-Package 5 - Smart well-being applications for lifestyle changes.

profile_positions.description:
“Support better research with less hassle” – this is our motto at Fibion. Fibion commercializes products and provides consultancy and training services to support the objective measurement of sleep, sedentary behaviour, and physical activity. 

At Fibion, I am the go-to person when it comes to ‘digital health applications’, ‘clinical trials’, and ‘behaviour change interventions’.
profile_positions.title: Chief Customer Officer

profile_positions.description:
SHINE 2Europe aims to promote inclusive communities to all citizens, by delivering research services and support to the implementation of tech-Savvy, Healthy and INclusivE solutions (SHINE) around Europe, with potential enlargement to the world. 

I work mostly on projects of the Horizon Europe 🇪🇺 framework and my key areas of expertise are ‘digital health’, ‘health literacy’, and ‘user-centred design’.

The "Personalized eHealth Technology" research program brings together several disciplines of the University of Twente (e.g. Computer Science, Biomedical Engineering & Design) to create innovative personalized eHealth services that substantially contribute to a sustainable, efficient and effective healthcare for all citizens, especially for those with chronic conditions.

profile_positions.description:

Roessingh Research and Development is the largest scientific research centre in The Netherlands for rehabilitation technology. It has three main clusters: Restoration of Human Function, Non-Invasive Neuromuscular Assessment and Technology-Assisted Pain Rehabilitation.

Currently I am developing my master thesis research.

volunteer_experiences.description: Pro-bono initiative that brings together Portuguese professionals, willing to share their career experiences with other fellow Portuguese facing challenging times in their careers or looking for a new opportunity. It's in tough times like the ones we live in that we must unite towards a common goal and give our fair share of support to others.
Programmes of letter exchanges between scientists and students in Portuguese-speaking countries
